bibl.title: Olkrytie novogo istoriceskogo istocnika v Nimfee. (Predeapitel'noe soobscenie.) Avec résumé en anglais: Discovery of a New Historical Source in Nymphaeum.
bibl.note: In 1982 excavations on the site of the Bosporian city Nymphaeum uncovered a sheet of polychrome stuccowork fallen from the wall of a room in a shrine of the first half of the 3rd century B.C. associated with Aphrodite and Apollo as protectors of seamen. Prominent among the objects depicted is a trireme named "Isis".
